compliant.section: Applicability: This Policy applies to personal data that Midjourney collects, uses, and discloses and which may include: (i) data collected through the Services, (ii) data collected through the process of training Midjourney machine learning algorithms, (iii) data collected through Midjourney websites, and (iv) data collected from third party sources.
compliant.legal provisions: Lawful basis for processing: Consent, Contract, Legal Obligation, Legitimate Interest

compliant.section: Third party sources may include, but not be limited to: public databases, commercial data sources, and the public internet.
compliant.legal provisions: Principles of data processing: Lawfulness, Fairness and transparency, Purpose limitation, Data minimisation, Accuracy, Storage limitation, Integrity and confidentiality, Accountability

compliant.section: When you make purchases, we use third-party payment processors to collect credit card or other financial information. Midjourney does not store the credit card or payment information you provide, only confirmation that payment was made.
compliant.legal provisions: Security of processing

compliant.section:
This Policy does not apply to the following information:

Personal Data about Midjourney employees and candidates, and certain contractors and agents acting in similar roles.
compliant.legal provisions: Scope of application

compliant.section: Changes: We may update this Policy from time-to-time to reflect changes in legal, regulatory, operational requirements, our practices, and other factors. Please check this Policy periodically for updates. If any of the changes are unacceptable to you, you should cease interacting with us. When required under applicable law, we will notify you of any changes to this Policy.
compliant.legal provisions: Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject, Information to be provided where personal data are not collected from the data subject

compliant.section: Definitions: Through this Policy, You, or Your means the individual accessing or using the Service, or the company, or other legal entity on behalf of which such individual is accessing or using the Service, as applicable. Company (referred to as either "the Company", "We", "Us" or "Our" in this Agreement) refers to Midjourney LLC. Usage Data refers to data collected automatically, either generated by the use of the Service or from the Service infrastructure itself (for example, the duration of a page visit).
compliant.legal provisions: Definitions

compliant.section: 2.1 Types of Data Collected
compliant.legal provisions: Consent, Contract, Legal Obligation, Legitimate Interest

compliant.section: 2.2 Use of Your Personal Data
compliant.legal provisions: Consent, Contract, Legal Obligation, Legitimate Interest

compliant.section: 2.3 Sharing of Your Personal Data
compliant.legal provisions: Consent, Contract, Legal Obligation, Legitimate Interest

compliant.section: 2.4 Retention of Your Personal Data
compliant.legal provisions: Storage Limitation

compliant.section: 2.5 Transfer of Your Personal Data
compliant.legal provisions: Transfers of Personal Data to Third Countries

compliant.section: 2.6 Security of Your Personal Data
compliant.legal provisions: Security of Processing

compliant.section: Our Service does not address anyone under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from anyone under the age of 13.
compliant.legal provisions: Protection of children's personal data

compliant.section: If You are a parent or guardian and You are aware that Your child has provided Us with Personal Data, please contact Us.
compliant.legal provisions: Transparency, communication and modalities for the exercise of the rights of the data subject

compliant.section: If We become aware that We have collected Personal Data from anyone under the age of 13 without verification of parental consent, We take steps to remove that information from Our servers.
compliant.legal provisions: Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten')

compliant.section: If We need to rely on consent as a legal basis for processing Your information and Your country requires consent from a parent, We may require Your parent's consent before We collect and use that information.
compliant.legal provisions: Conditions for consent

compliant.section: We may update Our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify You of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.
compliant.legal provisions: The controller shall provide the data subject with information on the following: (a) the purposes of the processing for which the personal data are intended; (a) the recipients or categories of recipients to whom the personal data have been or are likely to be disclosed, in particular recipients in third countries or international organisations.

compliant.section: We will let You know via email and/or a prominent notice on Our Service, prior to the change becoming effective and update the "Last updated" date at the top of this Privacy Policy.
compliant.legal provisions: The controller shall provide the data subject with information on the following: (b) the period for which the personal data will be stored, or, if that is not possible, the criteria used to determine that period; (b) the existence of the right to request from the controller rectification or erasure of personal data or restriction of processing concerning the data subject or to object to such processing.

compliant.section: You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes.
compliant.legal provisions: The controller shall provide the data subject with the following information: (1) the identity and the contact details of the controller and, where applicable, of the controller's representative; (1) the identity and the contact details of the controller and, where applicable, of the controller's representative.

compliant.section: If You are located in the European Economic Area (the “EEA”), Switzerland, or the United Kingdom (the “UK”) Our legal basis for collecting and using the Personal Data described in this Policy will depend on the personal data concerned and the specific context in which we collect it. However, we will normally collect personal data from you only where we have your consent to do so, where we need the personal data to perform a contract with you, or where the processing is in our legitimate interests and not overridden by your data protection interests or fundamental rights and freedoms. In some cases, we may also have a legal obligation to collect personal data from you.
compliant.legal provisions: Lawfulness of processing

compliant.section: Midjourney may share information internally or with third parties, as further described in this Policy. When we share Personal Data of individuals in the EEA, Switzerland or UK with third parties, we make use of a variety of legal mechanisms to safeguard the transfer including the European Commission-approved standard contractual clauses, as well as additional safeguards where appropriate.
compliant.legal provisions: Transfers of personal data to third countries or international organisations

compliant.section:
Additionally You have the following data protection rights:

You can request access, correction, updates or deletion of your Personal Data.
You can object to our processing of your Personal Data, ask us to restrict processing of your Personal Data or request portability of your Personal Data.
If we have collected and processed your Personal Data with your consent, then you can withdraw your consent at any time. Withdrawing your consent will not affect the lawfulness of any processing we conducted prior to your withdrawal, nor will it affect processing of your Personal Data conducted in reliance on lawful processing grounds other than consent.
You have the right to complain to a data protection authority about our collection and use of your Personal Data.
compliant.legal provisions: Right of access by the data subject, Right to rectification, Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten'), Right to restriction of processing, Right to data portability, Right to object, Right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority

non_compliant.section: As used in this Policy, “personal data” means any information that relates to, describes, could be used to identify an individual, directly or indirectly.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Definitions
non_compliant.amend: The definition of personal data should be aligned with the GDPR definition, which includes any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person.

non_compliant.section:
This Policy does not apply to the following information:

Personal Data about Midjourney employees and candidates, and certain contractors and agents acting in similar roles.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Scope of application
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clarify whether the exclusion of employee data is justified under the GDPR's scope of application. If not, the policy should be amended to include employee data.

non_compliant.section: 2.1 Types of Data Collected
non_compliant.legal provisions: Information to be Provided to the Data Subject
non_compliant.amend: The policy should explicitly state the legal basis for collecting each type of data, and provide clear and concise information to data subjects about the data collected, the purpose of collection, and the retention period.

non_compliant.section: 2.2 Use of Your Personal Data
non_compliant.legal provisions: Information to be Provided to the Data Subject
non_compliant.amend: The policy should provide more specific information about the purposes for which personal data is used, particularly for marketing and profiling. It should also clarify the data subject's rights to object to such processing.

non_compliant.section: 2.3 Sharing of Your Personal Data
non_compliant.legal provisions: Information to be Provided to the Data Subject
non_compliant.amend: The policy should provide more details about the categories of recipients with whom personal data is shared, including third-party vendors and business partners. It should also clarify the legal basis for sharing data with each category of recipient.

non_compliant.section: 2.4 Retention of Your Personal Data
non_compliant.legal provisions: Storage Limitation
non_compliant.amend: The policy should provide more specific information about the criteria used to determine the retention periods for different types of personal data. It should also clarify the data subject's right to erasure.

non_compliant.section: 2.5 Transfer of Your Personal Data
non_compliant.legal provisions: Transfers of Personal Data to Third Countries
non_compliant.amend: The policy should provide more details about the safeguards used to protect personal data transferred to third countries, including the use of standard contractual clauses or binding corporate rules. It should also clarify the data subject's right to access their data transferred to third countries.

non_compliant.section: 2.6 Security of Your Personal Data
non_compliant.legal provisions: Security of Processing
non_compliant.amend: The policy should provide more specific information about the technical and organizational measures implemented to protect personal data from unauthorized access, use, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. It should also clarify the data subject's right to be informed of any data breach.

non_compliant.section: Changes to this Privacy Policy are effective when they are posted on this page.
non_compliant.legal provisions: The controller shall provide the data subject with information on the following: (c) the right to withdraw consent at any time, where consent is the legal basis for processing; (c) the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.
non_compliant.amend: The policy should also inform users about their right to withdraw consent at any time and their right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.

non_compliant.section: In order to exercise Your rights please visit www.midjourney.com/account and follow the instructions listed at the bottom of the page to delete your account and data. Survey data that you may have submitted can also be accessed and deleted at this link. To access or review your account information, please follow the instructions listed at https://docs.midjourney.com/docs/info
non_compliant.legal provisions: Right to information, Right of access by the data subject, Right to rectification, Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten'), Right to restriction of processing, Right to data portability, Right to object
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly state how to exercise each right, including the process for submitting requests, the response time, and the contact information for the data protection officer.

non_compliant.section: Midjourney does not sell Your Personal Information, as defined under CCPA.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Lawfulness of processing
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly state the legal basis for processing personal data, including consent, contract, or legitimate interest. It should also specify the legitimate interests pursued by Midjourney.

non_compliant.section: The CCPA provides individuals residing in California or whose Personal Information was collected in California with specific rights regarding their Personal information.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Right of access by the data subject, Right to rectification, Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten'), Right to restriction of processing, Right to data portability, Right to object
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly state the rights of individuals under GDPR, including the right to access, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing, data portability, and objection. It should also specify how individuals can exercise these rights.

non_compliant.section: You have the right to request that Midjourney disclose certain information to you about our collection and use of your Personal Information over the past twelve (12) months.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Right of access by the data subject
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly state the scope of the right to access, including the information that must be disclosed, such as the categories of personal data processed, the purposes of processing, the recipients of the data, and the retention periods.

non_compliant.section: You have the right to request that Midjourney delete any of your Personal Information that we collected from you and/or retained.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten')
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly state the conditions under which the right to erasure can be exercised, including the exceptions to the right, such as when processing is necessary for the performance of a contract or for compliance with a legal obligation.

non_compliant.section: You have the right to opt-out of any sales, as defined by the CCPA, of Personal Information by Midjourney. However, Midjourney does not sell your information.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Right to object
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly state the right to object to processing based on legitimate interests, including the process for submitting objections and the response time.

non_compliant.section: To exercise your access, data portability, and deletion or do not sell opt-out rights described above, please visit www.midjourney.com/account and follow the instructions listed at the bottom of the page to delete your account and data (including any survey responses), or https://docs.midjourney.com/docs/info and follow the instructions listed to access or review your account information.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Right to information, Right of access by the data subject, Right to rectification, Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten'), Right to restriction of processing, Right to data portability, Right to object
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly state how to exercise each right, including the process for submitting requests, the response time, and the contact information for the data protection officer.

non_compliant.section: You may only make a verifiable consumer request for access or data portability up to two times within a 12-month period. You may make a verifiable do not sell opt-out request at any time.
non_compliant.legal provisions: Right to information, Right of access by the data subject, Right to rectification, Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten'), Right to restriction of processing, Right to data portability, Right to object
non_compliant.amend: The policy should clearly state the rights of individuals under GDPR, including the right to access, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing, data portability, and objection. It should also specify how individuals can exercise these rights.

non_compliant.section: Any such request must: (i) provide sufficient information that allows Us to reasonably verify that you are the person about whom we collected personal information or an authorized representative thereof; and (ii) describe your request with sufficient detail such that we may understand, evaluate, and respond to it.
